channel.title: Texreg on Cville R users
channel.description: Recent content in Texreg on Cville R users

item.title: texreg: converting model output to Latex or HTML
item.description: In the first example we use college admissions data to model gpa as a function of class rank, act score and year of admission. Three linear models are fit and summarized in a single table using the texreg functions screenreg, texreg and htmlreg. These functions create nicely formatted tables for the R console, LaTeX, and HTML, respectively. The second example uses NRC Data on research-doctorate programs to do beta regressions of PhD completion rates on Faculty Publications, Citation Rate, Faculty Grants and Institution type.
